title: Around the Districts : Cushinstown to Graiguenamanagh
body_text:
Around the Districts: Cushinstown to Graiguenamanagh
CUSHINSTOWN
Notes contact
Contact Rita Gaffney 0879914202, rita.gaffney@gmail.com. Notes must be in by 8pm Sunday night.
Rathgarogue split the pot
The winner of €203 in this week’s split the pot draw is Brendan Whelan. The winning envelope was purchased in Corcorans Bar and Off Licence and the draw was held in The Top Place. Thanks to Martin Connick for pulling the winning envelope. Enter to win next week via any of the secure payment links.
Rathgarogue/Cushinstown Community Games
Committee 2024 - Thanks to everyone for coming along to our AGM and Registration evening at the start of February. Our Committee for 2024 was elected at the AGM: Chairperson : Geraldine O’Brien
Secretary: Julia Fitzgerald, PRO: Julia Fitzgerald
Treasurer: Aisling O’Brien, Child welfare officer: Sinead Finn Committee members: Anne Kent & Nicola Tobin. Outgoing committee members: Sinead McCarthy
Draughts County Final - Well done to our 5 draughts teams who enjoyed a challenging and fun filled evening at the County Final in Bree Community Centre on Saturday 24th February. Two of our five teams placed. Our U12 team came in 2nd and one of the U14s placed 1st so the shield comes to Rathgarogue Cushinstown this year! Well done to all of our 31 participants and congratulations to our winners in the U14 team Liam, Daniel, Boe, Eimear, Cathal & Tommy! And to our u12 team Ciaran, Sophie, Rian, Diarmuid, Aoife, Reuben & Garvan! Our U14 will go on to compete at the Leinsters in April. Thank you also to everyone involved 8n organising the event.
Art and Handwriting Competition - Well done to all the amazing artists who participated in our area art competition in Terrerath Hall on Thursday 22nd February. There was a great turn out and we hope everyone had a fun and creative evening! A huge thank you to all the parents and committee members who helped out.
A huge thank you also to Rathgarogue and Cushinstown National Schools for helping us to organise the Handwriting competition this year.
Results for both Art and Handwriting below. The top three in each age category will participate in the County Finals in Barntown on 10th March. Results as follows: Handwriting U10 Girls, 1. Fiadh Wall, 2. Aoibhinn Finn, 3. Sofia Mires. U10 Boys
1. Davin Finn, 2. Diarmuid Hendrick, 3. Darren Reville. U12 Girls 1. Aoibhinn O’Brien, 2. Kaylee Byrne, 3. Jessica Reville. U12 Boys 1. Sean Ryan
2. Diarmuid Ryan, 3. Max Murphy. A huge thank you to Rita Whelan for judging! Art U8 Girls 1. Aoibhinn Kehoe, 2. Niamh Franklin Brennan, 3. Eve Coady
U8 Boys 1. Luke Fitzgerald, 2. Bobby Kehoe, 3. Brady O’Hanlon. U10 Girls 1. Emmy O’Shea, 2. Eve Cranny, 3. Aoibhinn Hayes. U10 Boys 1. Tom Hickey
2. Harry Kehoe & Tadhg Kehoe. U12 Girls 1. Aoife Mackey, 2. Sophie Kehoe, 3. Niamh O’ Leary. U12 Boys 1. Mark Finn, 2. Garvan Finn, 3. Rían Cranny. U14 Boys 1. Ronan Finn. Well done to all the amazing artists, and a huge thank you to local artist Anita Conway for judging. Thanks also once again to all the volunteers that helped in any way with these events. For more information about these and other events please follow our Facebook Page Rathgarogue Cushinstown Community Games and ask a committee member how to join our WhatsApp group.
Ballyanne Raquetball Finals
Novice Finals Results, Cynthia Bolger df Elanor Furlong , Andrea Hussey df Brid Ryan, Matt Roche df Mick Cody, Patrick Barron df Jack McGrath. Junior Results, U10, Bobby Kehoe df Harry Kehoe. U10 Diarmuid Hendrick df Denis Doyle. U11, Robyn Hickey df Sophia Byrne. U11 Sophie Kehoe df Niamh O Leary. U12, Kaitlin Cody df Ava Murphy. U12 Orla Cowman df Olivia Hussey. U14 Bella Cody df Hannah Ryan. U13 James Byrne df Tommy Ryan. U14 James Galavin v Ronan Finn. U7 winners, Cathal Hendrick, Peter Roche, Ben Tobin, Caoimhe Delaney, Ronan Delaney, Eve Cody, & Caoimhe Ryan. Main League Divisions 1-4 are wrapping up in the next few weeks.
Social Dancing
Social dancing is returning to the Horse and Hound on Wednesday 6th March. Music by Marian Kirby and guest Andy Radford. Starting at 9 until 11.30pm, refreshments served on the night. Entry fee is €10. All welcome
Substance Misuse and Addictions Awareness Event
Rathgarogue-Cushinstown GAA/Camogie and Ladies Football have organised a Substance Misuse and Addictions Awareness Event on Friday, 8th March at the Horse and Hound. Time: 7.30pm. Guest speakers on the night. Over 18 only event. (We will be organising something for U18s during the year).
This is a club event organised for club and wider community aimed to raise awareness about substance misuse and other addictions in todays society. Reminder Registration is open for 2024 season on www.foireann.ie for all information. Remember, all ages/players must be registered to train and play games.
Cushinstown AFC
Congratulations to local lad Denny Bookle and the Irish pool team who has just won the u18 European championship! Great achievement Denny well done to you and the lads from all at Cushinstown AFC.
DUNCANNON
Ramsgrange Active Retirement
The next monthly meeting of Ramsgrange Active Retirement will be held on Monday 4th March in South West Wexford Resource Centre at 2pm. The Annual subscription of €20 is now due. We have several upcoming events/Trips, planned over the next few months.
March: Cinema Trip to the ARC Wexford, date and film to be decided, contact Mary Ryan on 087 6530346 for details.
April: Trip to Wicklow Goal, Thursday 11th , a non-refundable deposit of €10 is required at March meeting, to be paid in full at April meeting. Contact Judith on 086 8110053 for details.
May: The holiday to Belfast from 6th-9th, is fast approaching, a few places still remaining, Contact Mary B on 087 2073966 for details. A reminder the final payment for the holiday is due on or before the April meeting on the 8th. A saving club is now open for holiday.
If anyone would like to come along to our outings, even if your not a member, Contact Alexia, on 087 9462160, for Information.
RCS Dog Walk Fundraiser
A dog walk fundraiser will take place on the grounds of Ramsgrange Community school at 2pm on Friday 15th March. We encourage all local people to come along with their dog (on a leash, please), and donate €5. This event is being organised by students to raise awareness and funds for the Irish Guide Dogs Association. There will be spot prizes on the day...including a prize for the best dressed dog!
Dementia Café
Wexford Dementia Café is held at at St Louis Day Care Centre, Ramsgrange Y34H283 on the second Thursday of every month from 2 p.m. to 4 p.m. Next date is Thursday 14th March.
Guest Speaker on Thursday 14th is Emer Finn, Occupational Therapist, Memory Technology Resource Room, New Ross Healthy Living Centre. Presentation Title: “Supportive Activities with your Loved One”
The Café provides a warm and welcoming space for people with dementia, their family and friends, social and health care professionals to meet, exchange ideas and learning.
For further information on how to attend please email stlouisdaycarecentre@gmail.com or telephone 051 389509.
FETHARD-ON-SEA
Local Notes
Please note that any items for inclusion in the District News will have to be with your local correspondent at tony46murphy@eircom.net before 7p.m. on the Friday before publication at the latest.
Hook Pastoral Area
His Excellency Bishop Ger Nash will continue his pastoral visits to the Diocese of Ferns. He will celebrate all of the Masses on the weekend of the 9th and 10th of March.
Note that the Saturday evening Vigil Mass in All Saints will be at 5p.m. Sunday Masses are 9a.m. in St. Aidan’s Church, Poulfur and 11.30a.m. in All Saints Church, Templetown.
Confirmation will take place on Friday March 15th at 11.m. in Our Lady Star of the Sea Church, Duncannon.
Fethard Bingo
The Fethard Bingo committee are holding their AGM on tomorrow, Thursday the 7th of March @ 6.45 pm. The committee are looking for any new members who would like to join a friendly bunch of volunteers to help with the running of the bingo. The weekly bingo is very popular and provides a valuable social outlet for many people while also raising funds for many local organisations.
Pilates at the Hall
Want to improve your posture, strength, flexibility and feel great? New Pilates Class every Wednesday at 6p.m. in St. Mary’s Community Hall. Suitable for men and women of all fitness levels. Book online at thistledownlodge.com/fitness-services.
Fethard Split the Pot
Congratulations to Rita Colfer, this fortnight’s winner of Split the Pot. Thanks to all who participated, to the businesses who have the buckets, without whom we couldn’t do it and to Josephine Kehoe for organising it. Buckets are located in Dillon’s Londis, The Wheelhouse Cafe, Fethard Pharmacy, Molloy’s Bar, Geminii Hair and Beauty, Fethard on Sea Tourist Office, Baginbun Lodge, Beautiful U, Salon 60, Castle Design and Hook Lighthouse. Draw every 2nd Wednesday.
Social Dancing
There is a night of Social Dancing in the Horse & Hound Hotel, Ballinaboola on Wednesday 6th March. Dancing to Marion Kirby band and Andy Radford as guest. Refreshments served.
RCS Dog Walk Fundraiser
A dog walk fundraiser will take place on the grounds of Ramsgrange Community school at 2pm on Friday 15th March. We encourage all local people to come along with their dog (on a leash, please), and donate €5. This event is being organised by students to raise awareness and funds for the Irish Guide Dogs Association. There will be spot prizes on the day...including a prize for the best dressed dog!
Mike Denver Concert
Tickets are selling out fast for the Mike Denver concert in Campile Hall on Sunday 24th March, with special guest Ray Lynam. Tickets can be obtained by ringing 087 2183300. This will be a non-allocated seated event and tickets are €30 each.
Coffee/Tea Morning
Senior Citizens Concern is hosting a Tea/Coffee morning in St Louis Day Care Centre Ramsgrange on Wednesday 20th March 2024 from 9.30am to 12.00 noon. Proceeds in aid of St. Louis Day Care Centre
Dementia Café
Wexford Dementia Café is held at at St Louis Day Care Centre, Ramsgrange Y34H283 on the second Thursday of every month from 2 p.m. to 4 p.m. Next date is Thursday 14th March.
Guest Speaker on Thursday 14th is Emer Finn, Occupational Therapist, Memory Technology Resource Room, New Ross Healthy Living Centre. Presentation Title: “Supportive Activities with your Loved One”
The Café provides a warm and welcoming space for people with dementia, their family and friends, social and health care professionals to meet, exchange ideas and learning.
For further information on how to attend please email stlouisdaycarecentre@gmail.com or telephone 051 389509.
Healthy Age Friendly Homes
Deirdre Mullally, a Healthy Age Friendly Homes Coordinator is giving a free talk in St Louis Day Care Centre Y34 H283 on 12th March at 11.30am.
This is a New Programme designed to enable older people to remain living in their own homes and to reduce the need to transfer to long-term residential care. It is a free service.
GRAIGUENAMANAGH
Graig notes
Email news items, club events, announcements etc for the notes to graignotes@outlook.com. Deadline is Saturday 6 p.m.
Lotto Draw
The numbers drawn in the Graig GAA and Highview Athletic lotto draw on February 26 were 9, 11, 12, 25. There was no winner. The following won €30 each: Anne O’Neill, Ellie Purcell, Yvonne MacCabe, Linda O’Brien, Ann Murphy. Jackpot now stands at €20,000. Tickets are available from any club member.
Graig Tidy Towns draw
Winners on February 29 were: 1st Prize - Vee, €500; 2nd Prize - Dick Furlong, €50; 3rd Prize - Mary Jonny Holden, €25. Draw takes place in the Abbey Centre at 4 p.m. on Thursdays.
Weekly clinic
Cllr Peter Chap Cleere will have his weekly clinic on Saturday mornings at 9 a.m. at his office in Main Street, Graiguenamanagh.
Rambling House
The monthly Rambling House is on the second Friday of the month in Newtown Hall, where you can enjoy music and song from local artists and also many from the surrounding districts also join in. The next session is on Friday March 8, at 7.30 p.m.
